creator: bill+apache@bfccomputing.com
text:
There's a bug in core.c that causes mod_deflate to fail if the request is
proxied, e.g.:

  RewriteRule /(.*) http://localhost:8080/$1 [P,L]

the response is not compressed, even if gzip encoding is requested.  This breaks
common setups for e.g. Tomcat.

This was investigated and fixed in 2.2 here:

  http://svn.apache.org/viewvc?view=rev&revision=327793

I've applied the same change to a 2.0.54 production server and it's working
correctly here, having served greater than fifteen million deflated pages with
the change.  I'll attach the patch I applied here.

Created attachment 19241
fix bug preventing proxied requests from being deflated

note: tested configuration: 

  AddOutputFilterByType DEFLATE text/html text/plain text/xml test/css
application/x-javascript
creator: bill+apache@bfccomputing.com
bill+apache@bfccomputing.com
text:
I'm sorry, I was being too narrow in scope when I reported this and picked the
wrong component.  Updated to acknowledge other filters and proper component.

It's not really necessary to file new bugs to request backports; just can just
add a note to the original bug.

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 31226 ***
creator: jorton@redhat.com
